TopicTitle: Where would you build your house in the Kerbal System?

Articles.Content:
If you could build your house and live anywhere in the Kerbal system, where would it be?

(I know these places are pretty sparse, but just pretend they are properly colonized)

I would live in the caldera of the volcano in Laythe's northern hemisphere.

Post a pic if you can like this.

Edited October 9, 2012 by nhnifong

I would live in the caldera of the volcano in Laythe's northern hemisphere.

Why would you want to live in a volcano? What if it erupts

On a serious note, probably Laythe as well, because looking up and seeing Jool, and maybe even the other moon's is pretty insane. Though the only moon of Jool I've visited is Vall.
So long as it's not near the KSC, I'm good.
Probably at the most distant planet when they are all released (No pictures yet) The pluto=like planet will be awesome

Why would you want to live in a volcano? What if it erupts

I'm just going to posit that this volcano only spews hot water and no lava, and that the whole place is like a Space-Hakone

Waterfront, next to KSC.

So views and a nice short commute to work
I was thinking of building a restaurant at the end of the Kerbolverse, I plan to live in that..

next to KSC?

thats suicide
Obviously Kerbin.
I got an O'Neill Cylinder up so I would probably live in that. Free transport and it can go anywhere I want it to.
i'd live on a giant spaceship... i like spaceships
C'mon pics anyone?

I'd wanna stay on Vall. Ofcourse assuming that that are supplies of food,water and air. if not, laythe would be my next choice.

off topic: what is the correct pronounciation of laythe?
Hmm, I'd love to have my own private rocket launching facility at the bottom of a crater in a mountain range, feel like a real supervillain. Either that or in a submarine on eve.
The sea of Beef - Ike.
And a nice daily fireworks display of exploding rocket parts

Why would you want to live in a volcano? What if it erupts

On a serious note, probably Laythe as well, because looking up and seeing Jool, and maybe even the other moon's is pretty insane. Though the only moon of Jool I've visited is Vall.

If the volcano was powerful enough to produce a caldera (rather than just blowing off the top part, leaving most of the mountain still intact), it would probably be dormant for millions of years. by then kermans would have gone extinct once they discovered that e = mc^2

So long as it's not near the KSC, I'm good.

next to KSC?

thats suicide

I lol'd at these. Because of the frequency of unfortunate accidents/debris everywhere/falling spacecraft, I would not want to be anywhere on Kerbin. Gilly might be nice, since it is easy to get off of, and several of Jool's moons look somewhat habitable. However, If I ever find it, I'd want to be on the

Magic Space Boulder

.
Gilly, Id love to jump high on that low grav!
As for were I would live, I'd choose the core of Kerbol. Could take advantage of the nuclear fusion goin on with a geothermal generator.
Beautiful view right there.
Minmus, i woulld love to do crazy stunts every mourning
